docs.title: Yet Another Japanese Setup Guide
docs.text:
Just another guide to set up your Japanese learning environment. There are a ton of guides on the internet for the best setups. For this guide, I used 7 guides in total.

Within this guide, I'll detail my approach to setting up essential tools such as Anki, Yomitan, and various immersion resources.

These resources include:

  • Websites
  • YouTube
  • Netflix
  • Manga
  • Visual Novels
  • Novels
  • and every other streaming website

First of all, we need to set up Anki and Yomitan. Simply follow the steps below:

docs.title: Basic Setup
docs.text:
1. Are you using a Japanese font?
  2. Download Yomitan
  3. Download and set up Anki
  4. Get decks for basic vocabulary
  5. Set up Animecards for Yomitan and Anki

docs.title: 第１課　食べますか
docs.text:
S

漢字 #### 会話1 ●　食べますか。 ■　はい、食べます。 ●　どうぞ。 ■　どうも。 #### 会話2 ●　今日遊びますか。 ■　いいえ、遊びません。 ●　明日遊びますか。 ■　はい、明日遊びます。 ふりがな

docs.title: 会話かいわ1
docs.text: ●　食たべます。 ■　はい、食たべますか。 ●　どうぞ。 ■　どうも。

docs.title: 会話かいわ2
docs.text: ●　今日きょう遊あそびますか。 ■　いいえ、遊あそびません。 ●　明日あした遊あそびますか。 ■　はい、明日あした遊あそびます。

docs.title: Lesson 2
docs.text: 第２課

docs.title: 何を買いましたか。
docs.text: 漢字ふりがな

docs.title: 会話1
docs.text: ●　魚を食べますか。 ■　すみません、食べません。 ●　何を食べますか。 ■　野菜を食べます。

docs.title: 会話2
docs.text: ●　昨日服を買いましたか。 ■　いいえ、買いませんでした。 ●　何を買いましたか。 ■　本と雑誌を買いました。

docs.title: 会話3
docs.text: ●　今晩休みますか。 ■　いいえ、休みません。仕事をします。 ●　いつも仕事をしますか。 ■　たいていします。

docs.title: 会話かいわ1
docs.text: ●　魚さかなを食たべますか。 ■　すみません、食たべません。 ●　何を食たべますか。 ■　野菜やさいを食たべます。

docs.title: 会話かいわ2
docs.text: ●　昨日きのう服ふくを買かいましたか。 ■　いいえ、買かいませんでした。 ●　何を買かいましたか。 ■　本ほんと雑誌ざっしを買かいました。

docs.title: 会話かいわ3
docs.text: ●　今晩こんばん休やすみますか。 ■　いいえ、休やすみません。仕事をします。 ●　いつも仕事しごとをしますか。 ■　たいていします。

docs.title: Lesson 3
docs.text: 第３課

docs.title: 昨日テレビを見ましたか。
docs.text: 漢字ふりがな

docs.title: 会話1
docs.text: 錫木さんは新聞を読みます。 上田さんは読みません。 錫木さんは音楽を聞きます。 上田さんも聞きます。

docs.title: 会話2
docs.text: ●　きむらさんは昨日テレビを見ましたか。 ■　いいえ、見ませんでした。 ●　私はよく見ます。 ■　私はあまり見ません。

docs.title: 会話3
docs.text: ●　昨日何をしましたか。 ■　お菓子を作りました。よく作ります。 ■　私は全然作りません。

docs.title: 会話かいわ1
docs.text: 錫木さんさんは新聞しんぶんを読よみます。 上田さんさんは読よみません。 錫木さんさんは音楽おんがくを聞ききます。 上田さんさんも聞ききます。

docs.title: 会話かいわ2
docs.text: ●　きむらさんさんは昨日きのうテレビてれびを見みましたか。 ■　いいえ、見みませんでした。 ●　私はよく見みます。 ■　私はあまり見みません。

docs.title: 会話かいわ3
docs.text: ●　昨日きのう何をしましたか。 ■　お菓子をを作りました。よく作つくります。 ■　私は全然作つくりません。

docs.title: Lesson 4
docs.text: 第４課

docs.title: これは何ですか。
docs.text: 漢字ふりがな

docs.title: 会話1
docs.text: ●　すみません、これは何ですか。 ■　辞書です。 ●　そうですか。分かりました。

docs.title: 会話2
docs.text: ●　これは雑誌ですか。 ■　はい、そうです。 ●　それも雑誌ですか。 ■　いいえ、これは地図ですよ。 ●　あれは写真ですか。 ■　いいえ、違います。葉書です。

docs.title: 会話3
docs.text: ●　こちらは佐野さん。友達です。 ■　あ、初めまして。加藤さんです。よろしくお願いします。 ♦　初めまして。佐野です。どうぞよろしく。

docs.title: 会話かいわ1
docs.text: ●　すみません、これは何なんですか。 ■　辞書じしょです。 ●　そうですか。分わかりました。

docs.title: 会話かいわ2
docs.text: ●　これは雑誌ざっしですか。 ■　はい、そうです。 ●　それも雑誌ざっしですか。 ■　いいえ、これは地図ちずですよ。 ●　あれは写真しゃしんですか。 ■　いいえ、違ちがいます。葉書はがきです。

docs.title: 会話かいわ3
docs.text: ●　こちらは佐野さのさん。友達ともだち友達です。 ■　あ、初はじめまして。加藤さんさんです。よろしくお願ねがいします。 ♦　初はじめまして。佐野さのです。どうぞよろしく。

docs.title: Lesson 5
docs.text: 第5課

docs.title: 私の時計です。
docs.text: 漢字ふりがな

docs.title: 会話1
docs.text: ●　すみません、あれは井今さん傘ですか。 ■　いいえ、あれは今井さんの傘ではありません。山田さんのです。 ●　これは誰のですか。 ■　さあ、分かりません。

docs.title: 会話2
docs.text: ●　すみません、それは私の時計です。 ■　あ、ごめんなさい。 ●　あなたのはあれですよ。 ■　ありがとうございます。

docs.title: 会話3
docs.text: ●　ターナーさんはアメリカの方ですか。 ■　はお、アメリカ人です。ボストンの人です。 ●　スミスさんもアメリカの方ですか。 ■　会社員のスミスさんですか、医者のスミスさんですか。 ●　医者のスミスさんです。 ■　アメリカ人ではありませんよ。イギリス人です。ロンドンの方です。

docs.title: 会話1
docs.text: ●　すみません、あれは井今いまいさん傘かさですか。 ■　いいえ、あれは今井いまいさんの傘かさではありません。山田やまださんのです。 ●　これは誰だれのですか。 ■　さあ、分わかりません。

docs.title: 会話2
docs.text: ●　すみません、それは私わたしの時計とけいです。 ■　あ、ごめんなさい。 ●　あなたのはあれですよ。 ■　ありがとうございます。

docs.title: 会話3
docs.text: ●　ターナーさんはアメリカの方かたですか。 ■　はお、アメリカ人です。ボストンの人ひとです。 ●　スミスさんもアメリカの方かたですか。 ■　会社員かいしゃいんのスミスさんですか、医者いしゃのスミスさんですか。 ●　医者いしゃのスミスさんです。 ■　アメリカ人ではありませんよ。イギリス人じんです。ロンドンの方かたです。

docs.title: Anki Decks
docs.text:
For our group meeting, I create my own decks:

  • Japanisch Schritt für Schritt
  • みんあの日本語
  • げんき (WIP.)

You can download the decks from my Dropbox.

I also intend to create decks for special lessons, where we want to read manga, short stories, translate lyrics, etc. But at the start, it is recommended to grind the thousand most common words in your target language and study a fair bit of grammar.

Note

You absolutely don't have to use Anki! If it's a pain in the butt for you using Anki, then just don't. The most important thing is that you have fun learning the language - the language learning experience should be positive! But at the same time, you should learn consistently, otherwise, you forget a lot of what you have already learned.

docs.title: Recommended decks:
docs.text:
Note

Use Kaishi's deck or the Core 2k deck.

docs.title: Kaishi's deck
docs.text:
Kaishi's deck is quite new and most surely the best deck to start your Japanese language journey. It consists of the most basic and used 1500 words. This is based and sorted by frequency (see Readme).

I highly recommend enabling the pitch accent on the cards! You can download the deck from AnkiWeb Kaishi or Kaishi's GitHub.

docs.title: Core 2.3k
docs.text:
I started before Kaishi did his amazing deck; hence, I used the Anacreon's optimized Core 2k deck. This is quite similar to Kaishi's deck and uses the core 6k deck as a base.

You can download it from Anacreon's own page.

There is also a modernized Core 2.3k deck.

docs.title: Even more decks
docs.text:
You can find other decks in those guides:

  • The Moe Way
  • The Lazy Guide
  • Itazuraneko Library
  • Immersion-Based Japanese Learning

docs.title: Anki Setup
docs.text: I used the setup guide from xelieu - the lazy guide And the guide from donkuri - Immersion-Based Japanese Learning.

docs.title: Download Anki
docs.text: Download Anki 32.12.1 Qt6.

docs.title: Creating an account
docs.text:
You technically don't need an Anki account. The account is only for syncing and backing up your decks and data.

Simply click on sync and Anki will check your current data with the data stored on AnkiWeb. If you are not logged in, Anki will ask you to sign in or create a new account. You can find your account under:

  • Tools
  • Preferences
  • Syncing

docs.title: Setting up Anki
docs.text:
Note

If you used Anki a lot in the past and you like the v2 scheduler, you don't need to change to FSRS. FSRS is a new algorithm for scheduling reviews. It's highly recommended to use the new scheduler [but don't forget to do a backup of your deck, just in case].

First of all, we delete the shortcut for the hard and easy buttons. It's best to not use the hard and easy buttons, see FSRS4Anki Q8. "In fact, FSRS is actually more accurate for people who rarely use "Hard" and "Easy" than for people who use all 4 buttons a lot" If you don't use FSRS, it's still better to not use the hard and easy buttons, because you could end up in the so-called Ease Hell.

Go to:

  • Tools
  • Preferences
  • Review
  • Delete Answer keys for Hard and Easy
  • Set Learn ahead limit to 60 mins

Click on the ⚙ next to a deck

  • click on option
  • scroll to the bottom and enable FSRS
  • apply the following options from the pictures

docs.title: Change settings to your liking
docs.text:
Note

Your Learn ahead limit: The learn ahead limit should be larger than your largest step. You could simply set it to 900 minutes.

If you are writing Kanji down while reviewing, you should adjust some parameters. This depends on how long you need to write down the kanji and then reviewing it:

  • Learning steps: e.g., 2m 5m 1h
  • Maximum answer seconds: e.g., 120

You may also change the display order:

  • New/review order
  • Interday learning/review order

docs.title: Installing Add-ons
docs.text:
Go to:

  • Tools
  • Add-ons
  • Get Add-ons...
  • Paste the number of the Add-on

After installing the Add-ons, you need to restart Anki. The same goes for changing settings for Add-ons. You need to restart Anki for settings to take effect.

docs.title: Why do I need Add-ons?
docs.text:
If you want to mine vocabularies, it takes a good amount of time to create a new card. You would need to configure a note type for Anki, defining fields, and the font and back template, and the style for the note type. After that, you can add cards to your deck, but you need to do this manually. With add-ons, you can automate the process of adding a new card to Anki.

Note

If you plan to use AJT Mortician, please read the description for AJT Mortician on the add-on page. You don't need to install the Local Audio Server for Yomichan. It only speeds up the process of getting the audio for a word.

Highly recommended:

AJT Japanese Number: 1344485230 AJT Mortician Number: 1255924302 AnkiConnect Number: 2055492159 Yomichan Forvo Server Number: 580654285 FSRS4Anki Helper Number: 759844606

Recommended:

Review Heatmap Number: 1771074083 Local Audio Server for Yomichan Number: 1045800357 Generate Batch Audio Number: 1156270186 Batch Editing Number: 291119185

Optional:

More Overview Stats 2.1 Number: 738807903 Pass/Fail Number: 876946123 Progress Graphs and Stats Number: 266436365 Study Time Stats Number: 1247171202

After this, you can download some Anki decks.

docs.title: Are you using a Japanese font?
docs.text:
How does 直 display for you?

This is really important for Anki, Yomitan, your browser etc. Source: Guide: Are you using the right font?

docs.title: Installation for Windows
docs.text:
• Press WinKey
  • Search Power Shell
  • Right-click Open as administrator
  • Enter: Get-WindowsCapability -Online -Name Language.Fonts.Jpan~~~und-JPAN* | Add-WindowsCapability -Online

docs.title: Apply font for Chrome
docs.text:
• Open Chrome
  • Open the menu ⋮
  • Settings
  • Appearance
  • Customize fonts

Select the following fonts: - Standard font: Meiryo UI - Serif font: Yu Mincho - Sans-serif font: Meiryo - Monospace: MS Gothic

Source: The Moe Way

docs.title: Reviewing
docs.text:
Check if 直 gets displayed correctly on the cards while reviewing: - Click on browse - Select / create a card with 直

If it does not display correctly, the font is installed incorrectly or not detected. Please ask for help or see: The Moe Way Font Anki. Maybe you need to force it.

docs.title: Edit fields
docs.text: Check if 直 gets displayed correctly in the edit fields in the note type. If not, you can change the font for every edit field. This is not really necessary but still good to see the kanji displayed correctly in the edit fields. - Click on Fields - Select a field where Japanese text is supposed to be displayed - Change Editing Font to a Japanese font: - e.g., Noto Sans JP

docs.title: Noto Sans JP
docs.text: If you like, you can use the Noto Sans JP font.

docs.title: Guides
docs.text:
Here is the list of guides I used:

  • The Moe Way
  • Immersion-Based Japanese Learnin
  • JP Mining Note
  • Animecards Site
  • Anacreon DJT

docs.title: Yomitan Setup
docs.text:
I used the setup guide from Immersion-Based Japanese Learning You can also use the tutorial from The Moe Way.

Yomitan is a dictionary and supports complete automated card creation with Anki. We need it to create cards automatically while immersing.

docs.title: Download Yomitan
docs.text:
You can download Yomitan for Chrome or for Firefox.

Make sure that Yomitan has access to file URLs. For Chrome:

  • Go to Add-ons
  • Manage Add-ons
  • Scroll down to Yomitan
  • Click on Details
  • Enable Allowing access to file URLs

docs.title: Adding Dictionaries
docs.text:
For Yomitan to work, you must first install some dictionaries. There are a ton of dictionaries, but for the start, download the dictionaries from my Dropbox.

After downloading, only extract the dictionary.zip.

Installation:

  • Go to the Yomitan settings
  • Go to Dictionaries
  • Click on Config installed and enabled dictionaries
  • Click on Import
  • Select all zips from the dictionary.zip

This import may take a while. Feel free to continue with the Anki download and Setup.

If you want to download more dictionaries, feel free to check out MarvNC's collection on GitHub or Shoui's collection on Google Drive.

There are different kinds of dictionaries for:

  • Japanese - English (J-E)
  • Japanese - Japanese (J-J)
  • Grammar
  • Specialty
  • Kanji
  • Pitch accent
  • Frequency

docs.title: Configure Yomitan
docs.text:
Download the setting file from my Dropbox.

In Yomitan, go to:

  • Backup
  • Import Settings
  • Select the yomitan-settings.json file

docs.title: Using Yomitan
docs.text:
Now you can hold down shift and hover over a word and a popup dictionary appears. You can also click on the audio button to listen to a pronunciation of the selected word if one exists.

After yomitan is running, you can check out how to create cards with yomitan.

docs.title: Connect Yomitan
docs.text:
I used the setup guide from JP Mining Note

We are using the jp mining note or more commently known as Anime cards.

docs.title: Installing
docs.text: The same steps are also found in the guide.

docs.title: Automatic way
docs.text:
If you have python installed and basic git and command line knowledge, you can use the automatic method of installing the note type: 

git clone "https://github.com/arbyste/jp-mining-note.git"
cd jp-mining-note

:: Ensure you have Anki open, and with anki-connect running
:: Also ensure that you have python 3.10+ installed.
:: It *MAY* work with lower versions of python, but I make no such guarantee. ;)
python tools\install.py

docs.title: Manual way
docs.text:
Download the Note Type:

  • Go to the release page
  • Download {version}-jpmn_example_cards.apkg

Import the Note Type to Anki:

  • Open Anki
  • Go to File
  • Import... the jpmn_example_cards.apkg

Download the custom fonts:

  • Download the 4 .otf files from the media folder
  • Click on the .otf file
  • Click on the download button at the top right

Import the custom fonts to Anki:

  • Press WinKey + r
  • Enter %Appdata%
  • Navigate to Anki2/YOUR_PROFILE_NAME/collections.media
  • Move the 4 .otf files into the media folder

docs.title: Verfying the Note Type
docs.text:
See JP Mining Note

You sould see a new deck JPMN-Examples in your collection.

  • Go to Browse
  • Select JPMN-Examples
  • Press Preview

View one of the cards an mkare sure, the card looks similar to the one in the pictures below:

(The following list is a one to one copy from the Setup Page from JP Mining Note)

  1. The fonts should match with the above example. If the fonts don't match, try restarting Anki. If the fonts still don't match, the note was likely installed with "Option 2: The Manual Way". Please verify you manually installed the fonts and placed them in the correct folder (see steps 3 and 4).

  2. Notice how at the top left corner, the info circle (the "i" encased within the circle) is the default grey color. If this circle is red or orange, there may be something wrong with the template. Please see this section for basic troubleshooting.

  3. Clicking on the image to zoom should work out of the box. Kanji hover may not work yet. If it doesn't work, read the Anki-Connect setup instructions on the next page. If the image suddenly appears without a zoom animation, then you must enable animations on Anki.

  4. If the furigana on your card seems to appear higher above the kanji compared to the picture, see the Fix Ruby Positioning option.

  5. If the frequency list on the top right appears to be squished (with no spacing between the elements) see the FAQ on fixing the frequency list display.

docs.title: How do I use the JP Mining Note?
docs.text: Please check how to use the jp mining note and how you can change the settings to suite your preferences. For that whatch the Videos under Gui, Fields and Card Creation form JP Mining Note Homepage.

docs.title: CSS Injector
docs.text:
For reference, see CSS Injector by JP Mining Note.

CSS Injector Number: 181103283

Delete the old field.css and editor.css:

  • Press WinKey + r
  • Enter %Appdata%
  • Navigate to Anki2\addons21\181103283\user_files
  • Delete field.css and editor.css

Or simply open a command prompt and: 

:: be sure to change USERNAME to your computer username!

del "C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\Anki2\addons21\181103283\user_files\field.css"
del "C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\Anki2\addons21\181103283\user_files\editor.css"

Creating a Symbolic link to the new field.css and editor.css:

Make sure to change: USERNAME to your computer username PROFILENAME to your Anki profile name

Open cmd:

  • Press WinKey
  • Enter cmd

After that change the USERNAME and PROFILENAME! and enter the following command: 

:: be sure to change USERNAME to your computer username and PROFILENAME to your Anki profile.
:: There are **two** USERNAME's to replace, and **one** PROFILENAME to replace
:: in the commands below.
:: Make sure to replace all the fields!

mklink "C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\Anki2\addons21\181103283\user_files\field.css" "C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\Anki2\PROFILENAME\collection.media\_field.css"
mklink "C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\Anki2\addons21\181103283\user_files\editor.css" "C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\Anki2\PROFILENAME\collection.media\_editor.css"

After that, restart Anki and check if your installation was successful; it should look like this:

docs.title: Edit AJT Japanese Config
docs.text:
Note

Unfortunately, we need to override the newest version of AJT Japanese because we can't change the config file easily anymore. If you don't want to do this, you can download my config file and configure the AJT Japanese options manually (not recommended): see: JP Mining Note Anki config-changes

Download the AJT Japanese Add-on from my Dropbox

Installation:

  • Press WinKey + r
  • Enter %Appdata%
  • Navigate to Anki2\addons21
  • Paste the AJT Japanese Add-on into this folder
  • Restart Anki

docs.title: Yomitan Anki settings
docs.text:
For reference, see CSS Injector by JP Mining Note.

Go to Anki and create a new deck for mining:

  • Press Add
  • Select the Japanese Mining Note
  • Click on Deck
  • Click on Add
  • Create a new deck, e.g., "Mining"

For your information, if you want to create subdecks, you can easily do so by putting :: in the name. For example, if you want to have a subdeck named "YouTube", you would add a deck named Mining::YouTube.

Go to Yomitan Setting:

  • Navigate to the Anki section
  • Select Anki card format...
  • Set Deck to your newly created Anki deck
  • Set Model as JP Mining Note

For more settings, see how the JP Mining Template works.
